name: Boogie Bill Webb
description: '''Boogie Bill Webb''' (March 24, 1924 – August 22, 1990) was an American [[Louisiana blues]] and [[Rhythm and blues|rhythm-and-blues]] [[guitarist]], [[singing|singer]] and [[songwriter]]. His music combined Mississippi [[country blues]] with [[New Orleans rhythm and blues|New Orleans R&B]]. His best-known [[sound recording and reproduction|recordings]] are "Bad Dog" and "Drinkin' and Stinkin'". Despite a lengthy (albeit intermittent) career, Webb released only one [[album]].
